metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9588 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
arch/x86/kvm/vmx.c in the Linux kernel through 4.9 mismanages the #BP and #OF exceptions, which allows guest OS users to cause a denial of service (guest OS crash) by declining to handle an exception thrown by an L2 guest. Jim Mattson discovered that the KVM implementation in the Linux kernel mismanages the #BP and #OF exceptions. A local attacker in a guest virtual machine could use this to cause a denial of service (guest OS crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9588` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
